intro: Wissadula lozanoi, commonly known as the Lozano's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick, fleshy tissues. Wissadula lozanoi is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in full sun.
